p: In addition to their roles as bioactive agents in SEDDSs, some vitamins and their derivatives can be used as excipients in the nanocarriers to assist absorption [ 61]. P-gp-mediated efflux is primarily responsible for the low bioavailability of some drugs and actives. Vitamin E and d-Î±-tocopheryl polyethylene glycol succinate (TPGS) appear to counteract the effects of P-gp. In particular, vitamin E can suppress P-gp activity and TPGS is used as a surfactant in lipid nanoparticles to enhance intestinal transport due to its potent anti-P-gp activity [ 62].
